knimeNode.name: Normalize Plates (NPI)
knimeNode.shortDescription: The node performs a normalized-percent-of-inhibition(NPI)-normalization based on two subsets of the data (positive and negative control).

intro.p: Groups of data (e.g. wells of a plates) are normalized relative to two subsets (e.g. some wells within that plate, e.g. some negative control wells and some positive controls wells). For each group the mean (or median) is calculated for the two selected subsets. Based on these estimates, all data points of each group are normalized by applying this formula:

x.npi = (x - mean(x[subset{negative}])) / (mean(x[subset{positive}]) - mean(x[subset{negative}])) * 100
or
x.npi = (x - median(x[subset{negative}])) / (median(x[subset{positive}]) - median(x[subset{negative}])) * 100
Literature: Malo et al., Nat. Biotechnol. 24, 167-179 (2006)

fullDescription.option: Select the column to define the groups (e.g. "barcode" for plate-wise normalization).
Select the columns with data to be normalized.
Select a subset that is used to calculate means (medians) of positive controls for each group.
Select a subset that is used to calculate means (medians) of negative controls for each group.
Median will be calculated instead of mean.
If checked the raw values will be replaced by the normalized values. Otherwise columns with the normalized values will be appended (.npi).
